title: >>> Did YOU Start the FIRE?
body_text:
Veteran Dan Spengeman has done it again. It is widely known that he has created some of the greatest designs in the history of dodgeball; DODGEBALL 18 and 19, DODGEBALL TWENTY-SIX, DODGEBALL XXX-ONE, among others. The ideas clearly keep on flowing with his latest work, the "firey" DODGEBALL 33 poster.
~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~
Last month, the average attendance was 26.25. That's pretty darn impressive for the last of the winter months. In all hopes, April will start off on a good note.
Another concern deals with the "invasions". In recent weeks, they have become more persistent when compared to the beginning stages of dodgeball. Can DODGEBALL 33 make it three weeks in a row? The only way to find out is to be there this Saturday.
One of the most deadly throwers, Kevin Fitzpatrick, is scheduled to make his long awaited return at 33. For weeks, he has been out of action due to a shoulder injury, which consequently required surgery. However, after several weeks of healing, he is prepared for his big comeback. You can bet he has a number of players already on his hitlist.
~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~
Not to take anything away from DODGEBALL 33, but the events that follow are shaping up to be quite interesting, and that's an understatement.
It is well-known that DODGEBALL 35 on April 9th will take place where it all began, Ocean Road Park, starting at 3PM.
As for DODGEBALL 34 two days prior, that will have its own unique twist. It's "trial and error"; a true classic it will be.
